{}.response: The United Nations has set 17 Sustainable Development Goals (SDGs) as a universal call to action to end poverty, protect the planet, and ensure that all people enjoy peace and prosperity by 2030. These goals are integrated—they recognize that action in one area will affect outcomes in others, and that development must balance social, economic, and environmental sustainability. Today’s information update on the status of these goals highlights some key objectives and progress against them. For instance, Goal 1 aims to eradicate extreme poverty for all people everywhere, currently measured as people living on less than $1.25 a day. The progress made so far includes efforts to provide social protection systems, targeted measures for vulnerable populations, and investments in poverty eradication programs. Goal 13, which tackles climate action, has had significant developments, including increasing investments in renewable energy, international agreements to reduce carbon emissions, and global initiatives to raise awareness about climate change. Furthermore, these goals promote partnerships and international cooperation to ensure all nations have the opportunity to benefit from sustainable development. The project-specific information you requested may be covered in more detail in other API endpoints that focus on particular projects or components of the SDGs. However, today's daily update reaffirms the commitment of the international community to these goals and the continuous efforts being made across various sectors and countries to achieve them.
